intro: Carmichaelia subulata, commonly known as the slender tree fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forest habitats, thriving in humid, temperate climates. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture. Carmichaelia subulata plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing habitat and food for various native species.
